title: Amazon dismisses climate criticism with renewable energy projects
text:
Amazon has insisted it is seeking to rapidly cut fossil fuel use after a backlash from the firm's own staff.

The online retailer unveiled two new solar projects in the US, as well as a wind project in Scotland – its first in the UK – that will help it hit a target for 80pc of its energy coming from renewable energy sources by 2024, and 100pc by 2030.

It is the company's latest effort to head off criticism over its green credentials from workers who believe it is not moving fast enough to cut oil and gas consumption.

Last month almost 1,800 employees said they would stage a walkout "to ensure our company is leading on climate, not following".
